revised_title: Manipulating Weed Behavior for Efficient Weed Control
tldr: The article discusses the inefficiencies of current weed control methods and proposes the use of growth-regulating chemicals to manipulate weed behavior for more effective control. It suggests targeting seed dormancy and vegetative regeneration as potential areas of development in weed control. The author also considers other aspects of weed behavior that could be manipulated for control purposes.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Ecosystems
